alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Houston (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Clayton, Allamakee, eastern Winneshiek, Houston and eastern Fillmore Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 743 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported strong thunderstorms along a broken line extending from near Houston to 6 miles northeast of Postville. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement has reported funnel clouds. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Caledonia around 800 PM CDT. Hokah, Brownsville and Harpers Ferry around 830 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Volney, County Roads A 52 And W 60, Choice, Quandahl, Riceford, Watson, County 5 And Peyton Road, Red Barn Campground, Churchtown and Locust. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in La Crosse.
